page.title: 07HIGH PEAK TRAIL (MONYASH)
page.content: { The High Peak trail}was built in{ {1830}to join up the canals at{Cromford and at{Whaley Bridge}to carry cotton from the cotton mill at{Cromford. It is now owned by the{Peak {District National Park.}The lines were taken up in 1968 ,and now the track is used by the public for riding,cycling and walking.It is very popular with visitors. At{Parsley Hay}(which used to be an old railway station) there is a{Cycle- {hire shop}where people can hire bikes to ride on the trail. The High Peak Trail is also important for{conservation.}Many wild flowers like{ox-eye daisy, scabious, {clover}and{birds-foot trefoil}grow along the trail.So the trail is replacing the species-rich meadows which are fast disappearing from the normal landscape.
